Class Apple

  • java.lang.Object
    • Apple

  • public class Apple
extends java.lang.Object
    Apples to be used in the AppleDrop game
    Version:
    11/10/19
    Author:
    Arnav Parashar and Dana Nigrin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_SPEED 
      static int RED_SPEED 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Apple(int screenWidth, int screenHeight, int clickX)
      Constructs a red apple at the top of the screen at the given x position
      Apple(int screenWidth, int screenHeight, int clickX, boolean isBrown)
      Constructs either a red or brown apple at the top of the screen at the given x position
      Apple(int screenWidth, int screenHeight, int clickX, int moveSpeed)
      Constructs a green apple at the top of the screen at the given x position with the given speed

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.awt.Color getColor()
      Returns the Color of the apple
      int getPointValue()
      Returns the point value of the apple determined by its speed
      int getSize()
      Returns the diameter of the apple
      int getSpeed()
      Returns the speed of the apple
      int getX()
      Returns the x value of the apple
      int getY()
      Returns the y value of the apple
      void move()
      Moves the apple down the screen
      void swat()
      "Swats" the apple by negating the speed

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Apple

        public Apple(int screenWidth,
             int screenHeight,
             int clickX)
        Constructs a red apple at the top of the screen at the given x position
        Parameters:
        screenWidth - the width of the screen
        screenHeight - the height of th escreen
        clickX - the x position that was clicked

      • Apple

        public Apple(int screenWidth,
             int screenHeight,
             int clickX,
             boolean isBrown)
        Constructs either a red or brown apple at the top of the screen at the given x position
        Parameters:
        screenWidth - the width of the screen
        screenHeight - the height of th escreen
        clickX - the x position that was clicked
        isBrown - true if apple should be brown

      • Apple

        public Apple(int screenWidth,
             int screenHeight,
             int clickX,
             int moveSpeed)
        Constructs a green apple at the top of the screen at the given x position with the given speed
        Parameters:
        screenWidth - the width of the screen
        screenHeight - the height of th escreen
        clickX - the x position that was clicked
        moveSpeed - the speed of the apple
